title: Executive Order 5270-Withdrawal of Land for Public Water Reserve, Colorado
content: Under and pursuant to the provisions of the act of Congress approved June 25, 1910 (36 Stat., 847), entitled "An act to authorize the President of the United States to make withdrawals of public lands in certain cases," as amended by act of Congress approved August 24, 1912 (37 Stat., 497), it is hereby ordered that the land hereinafter listed be, and the same is hereby, withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, or entry, and reserved for public use in accordance with the provisions of section 10 of the act of December 29, 1916 (39 Stat., 862):
T. 10 N., R. 100 W., all land within a quarter of a mile of Vermillion Creek which crosses what probably will be, when surveyed, secs. 1, 2, 10, 11, 15, 16, 17, 19, 20, and 30.
T. 9 N., R. 101 W., sec. 2, lot 5, S. ½ of NE. ¼, SE. ¼ of NW. ¼, NE. ¼ of SW. ¼;
sec. 17, SW. ¼ S. ½ of SE. ¼;
sec. 18, lot 5, E. ½ of NW. ¼, S. ½ of NE. ¼, N. ½ of SE. ¼;
sec. 20, N. ½ of NE. ¼, SE. ¼ of NE. ¼ NE. ¼ of NW. ¼ NE. ¼ of SE. ¼;
sec. 21, lot 2, SE. ¼ of NE. ¼ SW. ¼ of NW. ¼, SW. ¼, N. ½ of SE. ¼, SW. ¼ of SE. ¼.
sec. 35, SE. ¼ of SE. ¼;
sec. 36, lots 1, 14, and 15, W. ½ of SW. ¼
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5270-Withdrawal of Land for Public Water Reserve, Colorado Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361152
